question: A man buys an article for ₹800 and sells it for ₹960. Find his profit percentage.
If the average of five numbers is 27, what is their total sum?
A sum of ₹12,000 amounts to ₹13,200 in 2 years at simple interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
The ratio of two numbers is 3:4 and their sum is 56. Find the numbers.
A train 180 meters long crosses a platform 120 meters long in 12 seconds. Find its speed.
A can do a piece of work in 12 days and B can do it in 8 days. How long will they take to complete it together?
The average of 8 numbers is 25. If one number is removed, the average becomes 24. Find the number removed.
If the ratio of present ages of A and B is 5:7 and the difference in their ages is 6 years, find A’s age.
A shopkeeper marks an article 40% above cost price and allows a discount of 10%. Find his profit percentage.
A can complete a work in 10 days, B in 15 days. After A worked for 5 days, B joined him. In how many days will the work be completed?
If 12 men can do a work in 10 days, how many men can complete the same work in 8 days?
A sum doubles in 8 years under simple interest. In how many years will it triple?
A boat goes 24 km downstream in 3 hours and returns upstream in 4 hours. Find the speed of the boat in still water.
The difference between simple and compound interest on ₹5,000 for 2 years at 10% per annum is:
A sum of ₹8,000 is divided among A, B, and C in the ratio 2:3:5. Find C’s share.
If the cost price of 15 articles equals the selling price of 12, find the gain percent.
A pipe can fill a tank in 12 hours. Another can empty it in 8 hours. If both are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
A car covers 240 km at a speed of 60 km/h and returns at 40 km/h. Find the average speed.
The population of a town increases by 5% annually. If its population is 20,000 now, what will it be after 2 years?
If 40% of a number is 120, what is the number?
The average weight of 10 students increases by 2 kg when one new student joins. If the new student weighs 80 kg, find the previous average weight.
The sum of three consecutive odd numbers is 81. Find the numbers.
The compound interest on ₹5,000 at 10% per annum for 2 years is:
A fruit seller bought apples at ₹8 each and sold them at ₹10 each. Find the profit percentage.
Two numbers are in the ratio 7:9. If their sum is 128, find the numbers.
A train 150 m long passes a pole in 10 seconds. Find its speed in km/h.
If 25% of a number is 40, what is 12.5% of that number?
A and B together can complete a work in 12 days. B alone can do it in 30 days. In how many days can A alone do it?
The simple interest on ₹10,000 at 8% per annum for 4 years is:
A sum becomes ₹6,400 in 2 years at compound interest at 10% per annum. Find the principal.
The ratio of ages of A and B is 4:5. After 6 years, the ratio becomes 5:6. Find A’s age.
The area of a rectangle is 96 cm² and its length is 12 cm. Find its breadth.
A man walks at 5 km/h and runs at 10 km/h. He covers 30 km in 4 hours. Find how much he walked.
The sum of the digits of a two-digit number is 9. If the digits are reversed, the number increases by 27. Find the number.
A tap can fill a tank in 15 hours, and another can fill it in 20 hours. If both are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
The average of 10 numbers is 60. If one number is removed, the average becomes 58. Find the number removed.
A shopkeeper bought 100 pens for ₹400. He sold 75 of them at ₹5 each and the remaining at ₹4 each. Find his gain percent.
A number when divided by 5 leaves a remainder of 2. What will be the remainder when the square of that number is divided by 5?
If a train takes 3 seconds to cross a pole and 15 seconds to cross a platform 240 m long, find the length of the train.
The average of 4 consecutive even numbers is 27. Find the largest number.
A can complete a piece of work in 18 days, B in 12 days. They work together for 6 days. What fraction of work remains?
A sum becomes ₹8,820 in 2 years at 10% compound interest. Find the principal.
A person travels 2/5 of a distance by car and the rest by train. The speed of the car is 60 km/h and the train 90 km/h. Find the average speed for the whole journey.
The cost price of 20 pens is equal to the selling price of 16 pens. Find the gain percentage.
The difference between the squares of two consecutive even numbers is 68. Find the smaller number.
If a man walks 3 km at 4 km/h and runs 2 km at 8 km/h, find his average speed.
A mixture of milk and water contains 80% milk. How much water should be added to 20 liters of mixture to make it 60% milk?
A sum of ₹6,000 becomes ₹7,260 in 3 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
The perimeter of a rectangle is 60 m and its length is 20 m. Find its area.
The average of 5 consecutive multiples of 9 is 63. Find the largest multiple.
A shopkeeper marks an article at 40% above cost price and allows a discount of 10%. Find his gain percent.
The ratio of the present ages of A and B is 5:7. After 6 years, their ages will be in the ratio 7:9. Find A’s present age.
A sum of ₹5,000 amounts to ₹5,600 in 2 years at simple interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
Two pipes can fill a tank in 12 hours and 15 hours respectively. A third pipe can empty it in 10 hours. If all are opened together, find the time taken to fill the tank.
The average weight of 40 students is 55 kg. If the teacher’s weight is included, the average increases by 0.5 kg. Find the teacher’s weight.
The difference between simple interest and compound interest on ₹5,000 for 2 years at 10% p.a. is:
The perimeter of a triangle is 48 cm. Its sides are in the ratio 3:4:5. Find its area.
A train crosses a platform 200 m long in 25 seconds and a signal post in 15 seconds. Find the speed of the train in km/h.
A certain sum of money triples itself in 10 years at simple interest. In how many years will it double?
The compound interest on ₹10,000 for 1 year at 10% compounded half-yearly is:
A can do a piece of work in 15 days and B in 20 days. With the help of C, they complete it in 8 days. How long will C take to do the work alone?
If 12 men can complete a work in 15 days, how many men are required to complete it in 10 days?
A man buys an article for ₹900 and sells it at a loss of 10%. Find the selling price.
The sum of two numbers is 50 and their difference is 10. Find the smaller number.
A train running at 72 km/h crosses another train running at 54 km/h in opposite direction in 12 seconds. If their total length is 420 m, find the speed of the first train.
A certain number is divided by 7; it leaves a remainder of 3. What will be the remainder when the square of that number is divided by 7?
The difference between 60% of a number and 40% of the same number is 36. Find the number.
A sum becomes ₹2,420 in 2 years and ₹2,662 in 3 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest.
The average of 8 numbers is 20. If each number is increased by 4, what will be the new average?
If the selling price of 12 articles is equal to the cost price of 15 articles, find the gain percent.
The ratio of the speeds of two trains is 4:5. If the first train covers 400 km in 5 hours, find the speed of the second train.
A sum of ₹12,000 amounts to ₹15,000 in 2 years at compound interest. Find the rate per annum.
A boat can travel 30 km downstream in 2 hours and upstream in 3 hours. Find the speed of the stream.
The average age of a family of 5 members is 20 years. If the age of the youngest member is 10 years, find the average age of the remaining members.
A number consists of two digits whose sum is 8. When the digits are reversed, the number increases by 18. Find the number.
A and B can complete a job in 10 and 12 days respectively. They work together for 4 days. What fraction of the work remains?
A sum becomes ₹8,000 in 2 years and ₹9,600 in 4 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest.
A shopkeeper buys an article for ₹800 and sells it for ₹920. Find the gain percent.
A car covers a distance of 180 km in 4 hours. If it travels the first half at 40 km/h, find the speed for the second half.
A sum becomes ₹2,000 in 2 years and ₹2,420 in 4 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
